com.percussion.webservices.content
Interface IPSContentWs

public interface IPSContentWs

This interface defines all content related webservices.

Method Summary

Method Detail

loadKeywords

List<PSKeyword> loadKeywords(String name)
Loads all keyword definitions for the supplied name in read-only mode.

Parameters:
name - the name of the keyword to load, may be null or empty, wildcards are accepted. All keywords will be loaded if the supplied name is null or empty.
Returns:
a list with all loaded keywords in read-only mode, never null, may be empty, alpha ordered by name.

loadLocales

List<PSLocale> loadLocales(String code,
                           String name)
Loads all locales for the supplied parameters in read-only mode.

Parameters:
code - the locale code for which to load the locale, may be null or empty. All locales will be loaded if null or empty.
name - the name of the locale for which to load the locale, may be null or empty, wildcards are accepted. All locales will be loaded if null or empty.
Returns:
a list with all loaded locales in read-only mode, never null, may be empty, alpha ordered by name.

loadTranslationSettings

List<PSAutoTranslation> loadTranslationSettings()
Loads all translation settings defined on the server in read-only mode.

Returns:
an list with all translation settings currently defined on the server in read-only mode, never null, may be empty.

loadContentTypes

List<PSContentTypeSummary> loadContentTypes(String name)
Load all content type summaries for the specified name in read-only mode.

Parameters:
name - the content type name for which to load the content type summaries, may be null or empty, wildcards are accepted. All content type summaries will be loaded if null or empty.
Returns:
a list with all loaded content type summaries in read-only mode, never null, may be empty, alphabetically ordered by name.

createItems

List<PSCoreItem> createItems(String contentType,
                             int count)
                             throws PSUnknownContentTypeException,
                                    PSErrorException
Use this method to create a list of new content items. The server will construct the new items with default values and return them to the requestor. The items are not persisted until the user calls the saveItems(List, boolean, boolean, String, String) method for the returned objects.

Parameters:
contentType - the name of the content type for which to create new items, not null, must be an existing content type.
count - the number of items the user wants to create, must be greater than 0.
Returns:
a list of newly constructed content items of the requested content type, never null or empty. The returned items are not persisted to the repository until the requestor calls the saveItems(List, boolean, boolean, String, String) method for them.
Throws:
PSUnknownContentTypeException - if the user requested a content type unknown to the server.
PSErrorException - for any unexpected error.

findItems

List<PSSearchSummary> findItems(PSWSSearchRequest search,
                                boolean loadOperations)
                                throws PSErrorException
Finds all items for the specified search. The search object supplied can reference a saved search, which can be cataloged through the services specified in Searches, or individual search parameters.

Parameters:
search - the search used to perform the requested lookup, not null.
loadOperations - true to load the allowed operations for each search summary, false otherwise.
Returns:
an array of search summaries for the executed search, never null, may be empty.
Throws:
PSErrorException - for any unexpected error.

loadItems

List<PSCoreItem> loadItems(List<IPSGuid> contentIds,
                           boolean includeBinary,
                           boolean includeChildren,
                           boolean includeRelated,
                           boolean includeFolderPath)
                           throws PSErrorResultsException
Loads all items for the specified ids and loading options.

Parameters:
contentIds - a list with item ids to load, not null or empty. It is an error if no item exists for any of the supplied ids. This must be a content guid obtained from one of the IPS*Ws interfaces or from the IPSGuidManager.
includeBinary - a boolean flag to specify whether or not to include binary fields with the returned items. This flag is only used if no fieldNames list was supplied and defaults to false.
includeChildren - a boolean flag to specify whether or not to include children, defaults to false if not provided.
includeRelated - a boolean flag to specify whether to include the relationships of the related items, defaults to false if not provided.
includeFolderPath - a boolean flag to specify whether or not to include the folder path information for the returned item, defaults to false if not supplied.
Returns:
a list of content items with the specified details in the same order as requested, never null or empty. The returned items are read-only, use the prepareForEdit service to make them editable.
Throws:
PSErrorResultsException - if any item fails to load.

loadItems

List<PSCoreItem> loadItems(List<IPSGuid> contentIds,
                           boolean includeBinary,
                           boolean includeChildren,
                           boolean includeRelated,
                           boolean includeFolderPath,
                           boolean includeRelatedItem)
                           throws PSErrorResultsException
The same as loadItems(List, boolean, boolean, boolean, boolean), in additional, this has an option to load both the relationships as well as the related items.

Parameters:
includeRelatedItem - if both includeRelated and this is true, then load both the relationships as well as the related items; otherwise the related items will not be loaded. The loaded items contain non-binary fields and child entries only, but do not contain binary fields and the AA relationships with their dependent items.
Throws:
PSErrorResultsException

Throws:
PSErrorResultsException

saveItems

List<IPSGuid> saveItems(List<PSCoreItem> items,
                        boolean enableRevisions,
                        boolean checkin)
                        throws PSErrorResultsException
Inserts or updates all supplied items to the repository. All supplied items which do not define a valid item id will be inserted. All other items will be updated.

For inserts the following rules apply:

If supplied, all children and related content will be created as specified in each supplied item. Use the Content/Item Children services to manipulate individual child entries. Use Content/Related Items services to manipulate individual related items.

For updates the following rules apply:

If no children are provided with an item, children will remain untouched. If children are provided for an item, then new child entries will be inserted, existing child entries are updated and missing child entries will be deleted. To work on single child entries use the Content/Item Children services.

If no related content is provided for an item, then related content remains untouched. If related content is provided, then new related items will be added, existing related items will be updated and missing related items will be removed. Use the Content/Related Content services to work with individual related content items.

If no folder paths is provided for an item, then the folder paths remain untouched. If folder paths is provided, then new folder paths will be added, existing folder paths will be kept and missing folder paths will be removed.

Parameters:
items - a list of items to be inserted or updated to the repository, not null or empty.
enableRevisions - a boolean flag to turn on revisions for new items immediately. If this flag is true, any checkout of the item will automatically create a new revision. This flag is ignored for updates.
checkin - a boolean flag to specify whether or not to checkin all items after that save.
Returns:
a list with all inserted or updated item ids in the same order as supplied with the request, never null or empty.
Throws:
PSErrorResultsException - if any item fails to be saved.

                            String session,

                 throws PSErrorsException,

deleteItems

void deleteItems(List<IPSGuid> ids)
                 throws PSErrorsException,
                        PSErrorException
Deletes all items for the supplied ids. All items will be removed from the repository. This operation cannot be reversed. All items must be in edit mode for the requestor.

Parameters:
ids - a list of ids for all items the user wants deleted, not null or empty. This must be a content guid obtained from one of the IPS*Ws interfaces or from the IPSGuidManager. We ignore cases where an item of a supplied id does not exist.
Throws:
PSErrorsException - if any item fails to be deleted.
PSErrorException - for any unexpected error.

@Deprecated
List<PSCoreItem> viewItems(List<IPSGuid> ids,

                           throws PSErrorResultsException
Deprecated. Use viewItems(List, boolean, boolean, boolean, boolean)

Throws:
PSErrorResultsException

viewItems

List<PSCoreItem> viewItems(List<IPSGuid> ids,
                           boolean includeBinary,
                           boolean includeChildren,
                           boolean includeRelated,
                           boolean includeFolderPath)
                           throws PSErrorResultsException
Returns all items for the specified ids and loading options. All items will be returned read-only. The difference to the loadItems service is that this allows one to get specific revisions of items.

Parameters:
ids - a list with item ids to load, not null or empty. It is an error if no item exists for any of the supplied ids. This must be a content guid obtained from one of the IPS*Ws interfaces or from the IPSGuidManager. All ids may include the revision to view a specific revision. If an id does not include the revision, the current revision will be viewed.
includeBinary - a boolean flag to specify whether or not to include binary fields with the returned items. This flag is only used if no fieldNames list was supplied and defaults to false.
includeChildren - a boolean flag to specify whether or not to include children, defaults to false if not provided.
includeRelated - a boolean flag to specify whether to include related items, defaults to false if not provided.
includeFolderPath - a boolean flag to specify whether or not to include the folder path information for the returned item, defaults to false if not supplied.
Returns:
a list of content items with the specified details in the same order as requested, never null or empty. The returned items are read-only.
Throws:
PSErrorResultsException - if any item fails to load.

prepareForEdit

@Deprecated
List<PSItemStatus> prepareForEdit(List<IPSGuid> ids,
                                             String user)
                                  throws PSErrorResultsException
Deprecated. Use prepareForEdit(List)

Throws:
PSErrorResultsException

prepareForEdit

List<PSItemStatus> prepareForEdit(List<IPSGuid> ids)
                                  throws PSErrorResultsException
Prepares all items for the supplied ids to be edited for the requesting user. The user may call this multiple times for the same item but he is responsible to keep the correct PSItemStatus that this service returned with the first call.

Parameters:
ids - a list of item ids to be prepared for edit, not null or empty. It is an error if no item exists for any supplied ids. This must be a content guid obtained from one of the IPS*Ws interfaces or from the IPSGuidManager.
Returns:
a list of item status in the same order as requested. The item status will hold the status of an item in which it was before we prepared it for edit. Use this to call the releaseFromEdit service.
Throws:
PSErrorResultsException - if any item fails to be prepared for edit.

releaseFromEdit

void releaseFromEdit(List<PSItemStatus> status,
                     boolean checkinOnly)
                     throws PSErrorsException
Releases all items for the supplied status from edit mode. It is an error if an item is not in edit mode for the requesting user.

Parameters:
status - a list of item status, one for each item that should be released from edit mode, not null or empty.
checkinOnly - a boolean flag to specify that the release from edit service should only checkin the items and skip the functionality defined in PSItemStatus.
Throws:
PSErrorsException - if any item fails to be released from edit mode.

newCopies

@Deprecated
List<PSCoreItem> newCopies(List<IPSGuid> ids,
                                      List<String> paths,
                                      String relationshipType,
                                      boolean enableRevisions,
                                      String session,
                                      String user)
                           throws PSErrorResultsException,
                                  PSErrorException
Deprecated. Use newCopies(List, List, String, boolean)

Throws:
PSErrorResultsException
PSErrorException

newCopies

List<PSCoreItem> newCopies(List<IPSGuid> ids,
                           List<String> paths,
                           String relationshipType,
                           boolean enableRevisions)
                           throws PSErrorResultsException,
                                  PSErrorException
Creates a new copy for each supplied item. New copies are persisted to the repository and returned to the requestor in read-only mode.

Parameters:
ids - a list of ids for all items to be copied, not null or empty. This must be a content guid obtained from one of the IPS*Ws interfaces or from the IPSGuidManager. It is an error if no item exists for any of the supplied ids. If the same id is supplied multiple times, multiple copies will be created.
paths - a list of folder paths, one for each supplied item id in the same order specifying to which folder the new copied item will be added, not null or empty, must have one or the same size as the supplied ids.
relationshipType - the name of the relationship type to use, must be of category New Copy, defaults to the System/New Copy relationship type if not provided.
enableRevisions - a boolean flag to turn on revisions for new items immediately. If this flag is true, any checkout of the item will automatically create a new revision. Defaults to false if not supplied which means revisions must be turned on later through the workflow.
Returns:
a list with all new copies created, never null or empty. The new copies are persisted to the repository. To change the returned object you must call prepareForEdit for it and then save it through saveItems.
Throws:
PSErrorResultsException - if it fails to create a new copy for any id.
PSErrorException - for any unexpected error.

                                       boolean enableRevisions)
                                       throws PSErrorResultsException,
                                              PSErrorException
Creates a new promotable version for each supplied item id. New promotable versions are persisted to the repository and returned to the requestor in read-only mode.

Parameters:
ids - a list with all item ids for which to create a new promotable version, not null or empty. This must be a content guid obtained from one of the IPS*Ws interfaces or from the IPSGuidManager. It is an error if no item exists for any of the supplied ids. If the same id is supplied multiple times, multiple promotable versions will be created.
paths - a list of folder paths, one for each supplied item id in the same order specifying to which folder the new promotable versions will be added, not null or empty, must have one or the same size as the supplied ids.
relationshipType - the name of the relationship type to use, must be of category Promotable Version, defaults to the System/Promotable Version relationship type if not provided.
enableRevisions - a boolean flag to turn on revisions for new items immediately. If this flag is true, any checkout of the item will automatically create a new revision. Defaults to false if not supplied which means revisions must be turned on later through the workflow.
Returns:
a list with all new promotable versions created, never null or empty. The returned items are persisted to the repository, only changes to the returned objects must be saved to the repository through the saveItems method.
Throws:
PSErrorResultsException - if it fails to create a new promotable versions for any id.
PSErrorException - for any unexpected error.

getAssemblyUrls

List<String> getAssemblyUrls(List<IPSGuid> ids,
                             String template,
                             int context,
                             String filter,
                             String site,
                             String folderPath)
                             throws PSErrorException
Get the revision specific assembly urls for the supplied item ids and url parameters.

Parameters:
ids - The ids of all items for which to get the assembly urls, not null or empty. All ids may include the revision to get the assembly urls for a specific revision. If an id does not include the revision, the revision of the assembly url will be selected according to the 'context' of the request. If the 'context' of the request is 0 (preview context), then uses edit revision if the item is checked out by the requester; otherwise uses current revision. If the 'context' of the request is not 0, then uses public revision (if exists); otherwise uses current revision (if public revision does not exist). This must be a content guid obtained from one of the IPS*Ws interfaces or from the IPSGuidManager.
template - the template name for which to get the assembly urls, not null or empty.
context - the context for which to get the assembly urls, not null.
filter - the item filter name for which to get the assembly urls, not null or empty.
site - the site name for which to get the assembly urls, may be null or empty.
folderPath - the folder path for which to get the assembly urls, may be null or empty.
Returns:
a list of assembly urls for the specified ids and url parameters in the same order as requested, never null or empty.
Throws:
PSErrorException - for any unexpected error.

                                          String name,
                                          int count)
                                          throws PSUnknownChildException,
                                                 PSInvalidStateException,
                                                 PSErrorException
Creates the specified number of child entries filled with default values for the requested item and field set. The item must be prepared for edit prior to this call. All returned child entries will not have been persisted to the repository.

Parameters:
id - the id of the item for which to create new child entries, not null or empty, must be a valid id of an existing item. This must be a content guid obtained from one of the IPS*Ws interfaces or from the IPSGuidManager.
name - the field set name of the child for which to create the new child entries, not null or empty, must be an existing field set for the specified item.
count - the number of how many new child entries to create, must be greater then 0.
Returns:
a list with all new child entries filled with default values, never null or empty. All returned child entries have not been persisted to the repository, and their action is set to PSItemChildEntry.CHILD_ACTION_UPDATE.
Throws:
PSUnknownChildException - if the requestor supplied a field set name which is not defined for the specified item.
PSInvalidStateException - if the item is not prepared for edit.
PSErrorException - for any unexpected error.

reorderChildEntries

void reorderChildEntries(IPSGuid id,
                         String name,
                         List<IPSGuid> childIds)
                         throws PSUnknownChildException,
                                PSInvalidStateException,
                                PSErrorsException,
                                PSErrorException
Reorders all child entries in the order as supplied. The item must be prepared for edit prior to this call.

Parameters:
id - the id of the item for which to reorder the child entries, not null or empty, must be a valid id of an existing item. The item must be in edit mode. This must be a content guid obtained from one of the IPS*Ws interfaces or from the IPSGuidManager.
name - the field set name of the child for which to reorder the child entries, not null or empty. It is an error if the specified child does not support sorting.
childIds - a list with all child entry ids for the specified item, not null or empty. This list specifies the new order of the child entries. The specified child entries sortrank will start with 0 for the first specified child id and be incremented by 1 for any additional child id. All child entries that exist but are not specified with the supplied ids will be appended to the end in the current order.
Throws:
PSUnknownChildException - if the requestor supplied a field set name which is not defined for the specified item.
PSInvalidStateException - if the item is not prepared for edit.
PSErrorsException - if any child entry fails to be reordered.
PSErrorException - for any unexpected error.

@Deprecated
List<PSAaRelationship> addContentRelations(IPSGuid id,
                                                      List<IPSGuid> relatedIds,
                                                      String slot,
                                                      String template,
                                                      int index,

                                           throws PSErrorException

addContentRelations

List<PSAaRelationship> addContentRelations(IPSGuid id,
                                           List<IPSGuid> relatedIds,
                                           String slot,
                                           String template,
                                           String relationshipName,
                                           int index)
                                           throws PSErrorException
Create the content relations for the specified item, slot, template and index for the supplied related item ids. The type (or name) of the relationship created is determined through the slot definition found for the supplied slot name. However, the caller must specify the relationship name if the relationship name is not defined in the specified slot.

Parameters:
id - the item for which to create the new content relations, not null. This must be a content guid obtained from one of the IPS*WS interfaces or from the IPSGuidManager.
relatedIds - the ids of all items to be related to the specified item and slot, not null or empty. This must be a content guid obtained from one of the IPS*WS interfaces or from the IPSGuidManager.
slot - the name of the slot to which to add new content relations for the specified related item ids, must be a valid slot for the specified item, not null or empty.
template - the name of the template for which to create the new content relations, not null or empty. Must be a valid template id for the edited item and specified slot.
index - the 0 based index at which position to insert the provided related items in the order as supplied. If it is -1 or greater than the existing relationship size, then the new content relations are appended to the existing ones in the order as the related items were supplied.
relationshipName - the name of the relationship type (or configuration). It may be null or empty if not specified. If it is specified, then its category must be PSRelationshipConfig.CATEGORY_ACTIVE_ASSEMBLY. It will be used if the relationship name is not defined in the specified slot. However, it must be the same as relationship name defined in the slot if both are not null or empty.
Returns:
a list of created active assembly relationships in the order of sort rank property, never null or empty. All content relations are persisted in the repository.
Throws:
PSErrorException - if an error occurs while loading or saving relationships.
See Also:
loadContentRelations(PSRelationshipFilter, boolean)

loadContentRelations

List<PSAaRelationship> loadContentRelations(PSRelationshipFilter filter,
                                            boolean isLoadReferenceInfo)
                                            throws PSErrorException
Load all content relations for the specified filter. Note that a system may have thousands of relationships defined and the perfomance may be poor if the supplied filter is too general.

Parameters:
filter - defines the parameters by which to filter the returned relationships. If not supplied or no filter parameters are specified, all relationships of category Active Assembly will be returned. If the category of the filter is specified, then it must be PSRelationshipConfig.CATEGORY_ACTIVE_ASSEMBLY. If the relationship names of the filter are specified, then the category of the relationship type for the relationship names must be PSRelationshipConfig.CATEGORY_ACTIVE_ASSEMBLY.
isLoadReferenceInfo - indicates whether the reference info is needed in the returned objects. The reference info includes slot, template site name, folder name and path. It is true if the reference info is needed; otherwise the reference info will be null or empty in the returned objects.
Returns:
a list with all loaded active assembly relationships, never null, may be empty.
Throws:
PSErrorException - for any unexpected error.
See Also:
saveContentRelations(List, String), addContentRelations(IPSGuid, List, IPSGuid, IPSGuid, IPSGuid, IPSGuid, int)

reorderContentRelations

void reorderContentRelations(List<IPSGuid> ids,
                             int index)
                             throws PSErrorException
Reorders the related items specified via relationships and move to a specified location. All the items from the relationship list will be arranged together in the order they occur in the order as supplied and moved to the specified location. The first item (relationship) in the list will get the order specified by the new location. Specify 0 to move to top in the slot and -1 (or a value larger than the items in the slot) to move to bottom. All relationships in the list must be for the same slot and have the same owner.

Parameters:
ids - a list of relationship ids in the order that you want to reorder them, not null or empty. All relationships must have the same relationship owner and slot. The owner of all supplied relationships must be prepared for edit prior to this call.
index - the new location of the first item in the relationship list to rearrange. It is -1 (or bigger than the current number of relationships/items in the slot) for bottom and any other value specified becomes the sort index of the first item in the relationship list to rearrange.
Throws:
PSErrorException - if any error occured during reordering.

reArrangeContentRelations

@Deprecated
void reArrangeContentRelations(List<PSAaRelationship> rels,
                                          int index,
                                          String user)
                               throws PSErrorException
Deprecated. Use reArrangeContentRelations(List, int)

PSErrorException

reArrangeContentRelations

void reArrangeContentRelations(List<PSAaRelationship> rels,
                               int index)
                               throws PSErrorException
This is the same as reorderContentRelations(List, int, String), except it provides a list of relationships instead of relationship ids. Reorders the related items specified via relationships and move to a specified location. All the items from the relationship list will be arranged together in the order they occur in the order as supplied and moved to the specified location. The first item (relationship) in the list will get the order specified by the new location. Specify 0 to move to top in the slot and -1 (or a value larger than the items in the slot) to move to bottom. All relationships in the list must be for the same slot and have the same owner.

Parameters:
rels - a list of relationships in the order that you want to reorder them, not null or empty. All relationships must have the same relationship owner and slot. The owner of all supplied relationships must be prepared for edit prior to this call.
index - the new location of the first item in the relationship list to rearrange. It is -1 (or bigger than the current number of relationships/items in the slot) for bottom and any other value specified becomes the sort index of the first item in the relationship list to rearrange.
Throws:
PSErrorException - if any error occured during rearranging.

findDependents

List<PSItemSummary> findDependents(IPSGuid id,
                                   PSRelationshipFilter filter,
                                   boolean isLoadOperations)
                                   throws PSErrorException
Find all related dependents items for the specified owner and filter.

Parameters:
id - the owner id for which to find the dependents for the specified filter, not null or empty. Must be the id of a valid item. This must be a content guid obtained from one of the IPS*Ws interfaces or from the IPSGuidManager.
filter - defines the parameters by which to filter the returned children. If not supplied or no filter parameters are specified, all children will be returned for the specified item. Note, the owner of the filter will be ignored if specified. If the category of the filter is specified, then it must be PSRelationshipConfig.CATEGORY_ACTIVE_ASSEMBLY. If the relationship names of the filter are specified, then the category of the relationship type for the relationship names must be PSRelationshipConfig.CATEGORY_ACTIVE_ASSEMBLY.
isLoadOperations - indicates whether to load the allowed operations for the returned item summaries or not, true the allowed operations will be loaded; otherwise the allowed operations of the returned item summaries will be empty.
Returns:
a list of item summaries for all children found for the specified item and filter, never null, may be empty.
Throws:
PSErrorException - for any unexpected error.

findOwners

List<PSItemSummary> findOwners(IPSGuid id,
                               PSRelationshipFilter filter,
                               boolean isLoadOperations)
                               throws PSErrorException
Find all owner items for the specified dependent and filter.

Parameters:
id - the dependent id for which to find the specified owners, not null or empty. This must be a content guid obtained from one of the IPS*Ws interfaces or from the IPSGuidManager.
filter - defines the parameters by which to filter the returned parents. If not supplied or no filter parameters are specified, all parents will be returned for the specified item. Note, the dependents of the filter will be ignored if specified. If the category of the filter is specified, then it must be PSRelationshipConfig.CATEGORY_ACTIVE_ASSEMBLY. If the relationship names of the filter are specified, then the category of the relationship type for the relationship names must be PSRelationshipConfig.CATEGORY_ACTIVE_ASSEMBLY.
isLoadOperations - indicates whether to load the allowed operations for the returned item summaries or not, true the allowed operations will be loaded; otherwise the allowed operations of the returned item summaries will be empty.
Returns:
a list of item summaries for all parents found for the specified item and filter, never null, may be empty.
Throws:
PSErrorException - for any unexpected error.

loadFolders

List<PSFolder> loadFolders(List<IPSGuid> ids)
                           throws PSErrorResultsException
Loads the complete folder objects for all specified folder ids.

Parameters:
ids - the ids of all folders to load, not null or empty. Must be ids of existing folders. This must be a folder guid obtained from one of the IPS*Ws interfaces or from the IPSGuidManager.
Returns:
a list with all folders loaded for the supplied ids in the same order as requested, never null, may be empty.
Throws:
PSErrorResultsException - if any folder fails to load.

loadFolders

List<PSFolder> loadFolders(String[] paths)
                           throws PSErrorResultsException
Loads the complete folder objects for all specified paths.

Parameters:
paths - the fully qualified folder paths for which to load the folders, not null or empty. An error will be returned if any of the supplied path is invalid. Provide '/' to get the root folders such as Folders and Sites.
Returns:
a list with all folders loaded for the supplied paths in the same order as requested, never null, may be empty.
Throws:
PSErrorResultsException - if any folder fails to load.

saveFolders

List<IPSGuid> saveFolders(List<PSFolder> folders)
                          throws PSErrorResultsException
Save all supplied folder definitions. It can only existing folders, must use addFolder(String, String, String) or addFolderTree(String, String) to create new folders.

Parameters:
folders - a list of folders to be saved, not null or empty.
Returns:
a list of folder ids for all saved folders in the same order as requested, never null or empty.
Throws:
PSErrorResultsException - if any folder fails to save.

deleteFolders

void deleteFolders(List<IPSGuid> ids,
                   boolean purgeItems)
                   throws PSErrorsException
Delete all folders for the specified ids. The deletes are always recursive meaning that the specified folders including all child folders and items if requested are deleted. We ignore cases where no folder exists for any of the specified ids.

Parameters:
ids - a list of ids for all folders to be deleted, not null or empty. This must be a folder guid obtained from one of the IPS*Ws interfaces or from the IPSGuidManager. This deletes all folders for the supplied ids including all child folders recursivly. Child items may be purged if so requested.
purgeItems - a boolean flag to specify whether or not to purge child items. Defaults to false if not supplied. The requesting user must have admin previledges to purge items.
Throws:
PSErrorsException - if any folder fails to be deleted.

                              String path,

                   throws PSErrorException

addFolder

PSFolder addFolder(String name,
                   String path)
                   throws PSErrorException
Add a new folder for the specified label to the specified parent inheriting the ACL's from the parent folder.

Parameters:
name - the name for the new folder, not null or empty. Must be a unique label within the folder to which the created folder will be added.
path - the fully qualified path of the parent folder to which the new folder will be added, not null or empty, must be the path of an existing folder. If the requestor is not in the user list of the parent this will add him automatically.
Returns:
the newly added folder, never null or empty.
Throws:
PSErrorException - if the requested folder could not be created in the specified parent.

addFolderTree

List<PSFolder> addFolderTree(String path)
                             throws PSErrorResultsException,
                                    PSErrorException
Add a folder tree for the specified fully qualified path. All folders will be created starting with the first folder that does not exist in the supplied path. ACL's are inherited from the parents.

Parameters:
path - the fully qualified path of the folder tree to create, not null or empty, for new root folders you must provide a '/' with some name. The name must be unique within the parent folder
Returns:
the newly added folders, never null, may be empty.
Throws:
PSErrorException - if any of the path folders could not be created.
PSErrorException - if cannot find an existing folder from the specified path.
PSErrorResultsException

addFolderChildren

void addFolderChildren(IPSGuid parentId,
                       List<IPSGuid> childIds)
                       throws PSErrorException
Add all supplied children to the specified folder.

Parameters:
parentId - the id of the folder to which the suppplied children will be added, not null, must be an id to an existing folder. This must be a content guid obtained from one of the IPS*Ws interfaces or from the IPSGuidManager.
childIds - a list of object ids which we want to add to the specified parent folder, not null or empty, must be ids of existing objects such as items and folders, and must be a list of PSLegacyGuid instances. All child folder names added must be unique withing the target folder.
Throws:
PSErrorException - if the supplied children could not be added to the specified parent.

addFolderChildren

void addFolderChildren(String parentPath,
                       List<IPSGuid> childIds)
                       throws PSErrorException
Add all supplied children to the specified folder.

Parameters:
parentPath - the fully qualified folder path to which to add all supplied children, not null or empty, must be the path of an existing folder.
childIds - a list of object ids which we want to add to the specified target folder, not null or empty, must be ids of existing objects such as items and folders. This must be a content or folder guid obtained from one of the IPS*Ws interfaces or from the IPSGuidManager.All child folder names added must be unique withing the target folder.
Throws:
PSErrorException - if the supplied children could not be added to the specified parent.

removeFolderChildren

void removeFolderChildren(IPSGuid parentId,
                          List<IPSGuid> childIds,
                          boolean purgeItems)
                          throws PSErrorsException,
                                 PSErrorException
Removes the supplied folder children from the specified folder.

Parameters:
parentId - the id of the folder from which we want the children removed, not null, must be an id of an existing folder. This must be a folder guid obtained from one of the IPS*Ws interfaces or from the IPSGuidManager.
childIds - a list of object ids which we want removed from the specified folder. All folders and items will be removed if not specified. We ignore ids for which no child object is found.
purgeItems - a boolean flag to specify whether we only want items removed from the folder or purged from the system entirely. Defaults to false if not supplied. The requesting user must have admin previledges to purge items.
Throws:
PSErrorsException - if any child folder fails to be removed from the parent.
PSErrorException - if any other error occurs.

removeFolderChildren

void removeFolderChildren(String parentPath,
                          List<IPSGuid> childIds,
                          boolean purgeItems)
                          throws PSErrorsException,
                                 PSErrorException
Removes the supplied folder children from the specified folder.

Parameters:
parentPath - the fully qualified folder path from which to remove all supplied children, not null or empty, must be the path of an existing folder.
childIds - a list of object ids which we want removed from the specified folder. All folders and items will be removed if not specified. Each entry must be a content or folder guid obtained from one of the IPS*Ws interfaces or from the IPSGuidManager.
purgeItems - a boolean flag to specify whether we only want items removed from the folder or purged from the system entirely. Defaults to false if not supplied. The requesting user must have admin previledges to purge items.
Throws:
PSErrorsException - if any child folder fails to be removed from the parent.
PSErrorException - if any other error occurs.

moveFolderChildren

void moveFolderChildren(IPSGuid sourceId,
                        IPSGuid targetId,
                        List<IPSGuid> childIds)
                        throws PSErrorException
Moves the specified folder children from the source to the target folder.

Parameters:
sourceId - the id of the source folder from which to move the specified objects, not null. Must be the id of an existing folder. This must be a folder guid obtained from one of the IPS*Ws interfaces or from the IPSGuidManager.
targetId - the id of the target folder to which to move the specified objects, not null. Must be the id of an existing folder. This must be a folder guid obtained from one of the IPS*Ws interfaces or from the IPSGuidManager.
childIds - a list of object ids to be moved from the source to the target folder. All source objects will be moved if not specified. Must be ids of existing objects. All child folder names moved must be unique withing the target folder. Each entry must be a content or folder guid obtained from one of the IPS*Ws interfaces or from the IPSGuidManager.
Throws:
PSErrorException - if the specified source folder does not contain any of the specified child ids. or an unexpected error occurs.

moveFolderChildren

void moveFolderChildren(String sourcePath,
                        String targetPath,
                        List<IPSGuid> childIds)
                        throws PSErrorException
Moves the specified folder children from the source to the target folder.

Parameters:
sourcePath - the fully qualified source folder path from which to move all supplied children, not null or empty, must be the path of an existing folder.
targetPath - the fully qualified target folder path to which to move all supplied children, not null or empty, must be the path of an existing folder.
childIds - a list of object ids to be moved from the source to the target folder. All source objects will be moved if not specified. Must be ids of existing objects. All child folder names moved must be unique withing the target folder. Each entry must be a content or folder guid obtained from one of the IPS*Ws interfaces or from the IPSGuidManager.
Throws:
PSErrorException - if the specified source folder does not contain any of the specified child ids; or one of the the specified folder paths (source and target) is invalid, or an unexpected error occurs.

                         throws PSErrorException
Find the parent path for the specified object.

Parameters:
id - the id of the object for which to find the parents, not null. Must be the id of an existing object. This must be a content or folder guid obtained from one of the IPS*Ws interfaces or from the IPSGuidManager.
Returns:
a list with complete folder paths such as //Sites/EnterpriseInvestments/Images for the specified object, never null, may be empty.
Throws:
PSErrorException - for any unexpected error.

findPathIds

List<IPSGuid> findPathIds(String path)
                          throws PSErrorException
Find all ids for the specified path. For an input path of //Sites/EnterpriseInvestments/InvestmentAdvice/Retirement you would get back a list with 4 ids. The first id identifies the Sites folder, the next id the EnterpriseInvestments folder and so on.

Parameters:
path - a fully qualified path for which to find the ids, not null or empty. The path must identify an existing object.
Returns:
a list with all path ids ordered top down, never null or empty.
Throws:
PSErrorException - for any unexpected error.

getIdByPath

IPSGuid getIdByPath(String path)
                    throws PSErrorException
Gets the guid of item or folder for the specified path.

Parameters:
path - a fully qualified path(case sensitive) for which to find the id, not null or empty.
Returns:
IPSGuid of the item or folder corresponding to the supplied path or null if the path does not correspond to any item or folder. The guid will have -1 for revision.
Throws:
PSErrorException - for any unexpected error.
